Name: David D
Title: Probably the most iconic sight in Jaipur.
Review: The Hawa Mahal is a beautiful and iconic sight. It is a series of 365 latticed windows created in a harmonious whole soaring up from the streets. It was to enable the ladies of the palace to gaze out into the town rather than being entirely secluded. It is well worth seeing. Be advised though that there are a lot of tourist shops on this street.

Name: Raghav
Title: Magnificent
Review: An extremely beautiful site . I love the windows of Hawa Mahal. It is so magnificent. In the night it so Adorable

Name: SwarupDukuria
Title: Outside is good but inside tour can be skipped
Review: Agree this is a landmark but very poorly managed. You can click pics from outside and inside tour can be skipped. Single ticket window. Long queue. Nah. You can miss it.

Name: Pritam Sadhukhan
Title: Best viewed at night
Review: This is the landmark of Jaipur and a must visit. The place is the heart of the city and many other attractions are just near by.Even few of the best markets are at walkable distance.

Name: Arun Mani Kanta Gunda
Title: Superb
Review: It is the must visit place in Jaipur ,the architecture had no words to explain, really excited seeing this place energy is cool

Name: Vijit B
Title: Where and when of nice photo short
Review: Nice place for photo, shopping around.The best time for photo is early morning 6-7 am, which no people on road infront of it. The afternoon time is peak clouded, should go to the roof top Cafe in the opposite site ( Tatto Cafe) you will get stun view for portrait.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Beautiful Historical Palace
Review: Hawa Mahal is a beautiful historical palace located in the Jaipur centre which is connected to and near the family Palace and museum. Its now only accessible to be observed from the outside roadside and to take photos. In the nighttime the lighting provides an awesome sight. Having a pre-arranged guide to provide the history and context is recommended.

Name: TravellerFoodie
Title: Best place in Jaipur for night
Review: Beautiful Hawa Mahal in Jaipur located in the Jaipur city.its very old palace now only accessible from outside to take photos and shoot.inside they are not allowing.the beauty is more in the night as looks awesome in night with the lighting.its near city center. There are other famous places nearby hawa mahal.you can easily get rikshaw for 20 or 30₹ for tour and other places to visit.You can see detailed information in my video

Name: AJAYAERON
Title: Historical Marvel
Review: Excellent Historical Marvel to visit & experience the amazing Palace of Wind. A must-visit place for everyone and no Skip

Name: KittyinLondon
Title: 5 min for photos and you're done
Review: We saw this about 10 times during our stay in Jaipur and a couple of times at night. It's much prettier at night. All you need is 5 min to pose for a photo. We didn't venture inside as people told us it could get very crowded in narrow passageways and there wasn't much to see past the facade. You can get some geat photos from cafe's across the street

Name: Rishi S
Title: Okie dokie
Review: This place is hyped a lot but really it's nothing much to see....just a palace with a lot of small windows The crowd on that street really makes it difficult to even get a good picture of the Mahal.

Name: 123GYPSY
Title: Huge and beautiful at night
Review: Hawa mahal is located centrally and is a huge structure with many windows making it extremely breezy! Right outside of the hawa mahal is street shopping that I found more interesting. The road is normally having traffic jam throughout and it’s best to take an auto when visiting this place as parking can get tedious There are cafés on the opposite side of the road that offer good balconies for clicking pics

Name: tarun9369
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: Most people didn't know that Hawa Mahal can be seen from inside also...and it's not just a wall of jharokhas but more than that...entry ticket is rs 50 for Indian adult...you can go to various towers but the stairs are very narrow and only one side entry is allowed so be ready for waiting time...once you get at the top u can see various parts of old jaipur including the amer fort and fort walls stretching across the hills....

Name: John L
Title: Gorgeous facade and story
Review: Beautiful place to visit and especially with a guide where you hear about all the detail and how it all functioned when built - beautiful facade

Name: Mumtaazrs
Title: Simply stunning.
Review: Awesome and stunning monument, very much in the heart of the pink city. Specially in the night when it is fully lit up. Don't miss this place.

Name: singhasam
Title: Striking frontage
Review: WHEN I first saw Hawa Mahal I couldn't believe how bright, sharp and colourful the frontage was.It is also known as Palace of Wind or the Wind Palace and was built in 1799 from red and pink sandstone.I haven't counted them all but it is said to have 953 small windows decorated with intricate latticework for the ladies of the time to look out on passing life without being seen.The palace itself is a five-storey pyramidal structure the top three floors of which have the width of a single room while the first and second floors have patios in front of them.But it was the striking colours of the frontage I will remember. Definitely worth a visit despite the contrast between the palace and nearby heaps of rubbish.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Hawa at hawa mahal
Review: An historical place but believe me what has been done to it and its surrounding. You have local vendors just sitting in front and around, highly polluted and difficult to approach.

Name: Aditi
Title: Photo stop
Review: Palace of wind( hawa mahal ) one of iconic monuments in jaipur. Most photo taken also. It is like crown of Krishna.

Name: Juliana S
Title: Masterpiece
Review: It's a beautiful architectural masterpiece. I do recommend everyone to take time and go visit. About the prices, we had a chance to get a all in one ticket to visit all the important places of Jaipur. Validity for 2 days for 1000 inr (foreigner price). And for Indian nationals 400 inr.

Name: ian m
Title: Jaipur must-see.
Review: The problem here is getting a decent view of the palace as it's situated on a very busy street and you're constantly bothered by hawkers and beggers. To get a decent view in comfort the easiest solution is to cross the road (not that easy) and climb to one of the high level cafes opposite (Tattoo was our choice) where for the price of a Coke you can go out onto the rooftop and stay as long as you like.

Name: Charlie Jo
Title: Picturesque!
Review: Most mesmerising structures in India have been covered by me but this one beats them all. Perfect time to visit is during the evening.

Name: Ruchi Gupta
Title: Beautiful
Review: Beautifully designed,worth visiting. Gives mind food for thought as to the architectural intelligence in the past.

Name: Vandana
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: A great place for some memorable photos. Nothing much to see inside. But looks majestic from the outside. One can go to the top most floors of the mahel to get a good birds eye view of the city.

Name: SF Guy
Title: Amazing Site
Review: Amazing site in the middle of town and even more amazing at night. Also, you enter from the back where there is a fountain and rooms to see.

Name: Subrat Saurabh
Title: Good one time visit
Review: This place is in the heart of old Jaipur and near to market. 10 minute is enough to visit this place and there is nothing much to visit here. You will find allot of good stuff to buy from local market near this place and need to negotiate the price well

Name: DanWon74
Title: More impressive from outside
Review: Inside tour is not very interesting due to hoards of people squeezing through too little space. View from top nice, but very crowded (better skip if nervous about pandemic). I liked the outside view from across the street much more. Would not do the interior again.

Name: Jayesh M
Title: Jayesh Mor
Review: Its a Beautiful place, must see with the help of local guide...you will enjoy the History and importance of places there.

Name: montykhan65@gmail.com
Title: Something amazing in Jaipur..!!
Review: A very beautiful pieces of work, everything here has a value of character. More you see that more you love. Raj bari definitely worth of visit.

Name: Aakash V
Title: Unorganised by tourism department
Review: Unhygienic. Chaos. Nightmare crowd control. Poorly maintained. Stinking public toilets uncleaned in years. Total let down

Name: Noam B
Title: Very nice from outside, not too much to see inside
Review: The beautyfull symbol of Jaipur, the inside is rather dull and you don't have access to the windows.

Name: robert
Title: beautiful
Review: Beautiful Hawa Mahal in the middle of the city. Must visit.. There's beautiful views of the city as u climb up the palace floors.You can a beautiful view of its rear from the street. There are 4 floors, all were designed for some specific purpose.also hear sunset views was awesome. From the top, you can overlook the city. The middle floors has colorful lattice windows

Name: Hến M
Title: Really good experience
Review: It was a beautiful palace. Super crowded inside. I like to take a walk all over the palace to imagine the past life they were had. The puppeteers are so friendly and energetic. Love them.

Name: Sitaram B
Title: Historical place
Review: Nice to visit once. U will not be interested to re visit to explore this place again. For first time it will be good place to explore this historic location

Name: dhyancoelho
Title: Nice
Review: As the name....palace of wind ..Located in the centre of a market area . Its always crowdered.  Very interesting structure with hundreds of little windows.  What looks like a huge building turns out to be a slim building with a lot of stairs..Pls use public transport to get here unless you visiting the city palace where you can park n walk to Hawa Mahal.

Name: Rhianna
Title: Not worth the visit
Review: The front looks nothing like the photos- even though it’s still nice it’s not comparable, and the inside is pointless, especially because you have to pay to get in

Name: Priyanka
Title: Beautiful
Review: Beautiful piece of art located in the heart of city Jaipur. Better view in the night time. During the day time overtly crowded area.

Name: Gufran
Title: Photography
Review: Hawa mahal is wind place inside the hawa Mahal three hundred sixte windows and amazing photo point and the ticket is very cheep

Name: Jonesamer
Title: Wind place
Review: Hawa mahal the wind place is amazing place for photography hawa mahal not a mahal is a window place inside the hawa mahal 360 windows

Name: Kate T
Title: Tour guide bring me to "Crocodile" shop
Review: We went to Jaipur under so called a luxury trip by MxGxDX travel agency. Their tour guide very irresponsible. After fail to con us to buy at "Crocodile shop" he went missing in action for the plan trip suppose to choki dhani village. We heavily suspect there's a collusion between tour guide and the so called government approved shop that CON tourist.  In comparison to yesterday's enthusiasm, Tour Guide A's attitude has altered indifferently. After an hour of useless lingering around Amber Fort, Tour Guide A suggested that we go to a restaurant for lunch and then return to the hotel while waiting for the Mercedes E-Class to fix its air conditioning. All afternoon activities have been cancelled or postponed until the car's air conditioning has been repaired. There was no backup plan or additional transportation arranged by the trip agency (MXGXDX Travel). At this Jaipur town, tour guide bring us to buy super expensive goods. Please see photo attached as evidence!

Name: vivek0210
Title: World's tallest building built with no foundation
Review: Hawaa Mahal is Wind Palace. This unique structure captures the brilliance of Rajput architecture. Not many people know that Hawaa Mahal is the world's tallest structure (5 stories) built with no foundation.

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Hawa mahal - windy place
Review: Its in the middle of the main market. You can spend 1 hour here.  Its a small palace so its very crowded at all times as there is not much place to move around in the palace.

Name: Abel S
Title: Majestic Architecture
Review: It is one of those places that you need to visit once in your lifetime. The artistry of glass windows and the jharokha architectures are mesmerizing. They transport you to a world where even the buildings showed off grandeur. They told the stories of the luxurious lives of their residents.

Name: exploredaunexplored
Title: Photo stop
Review: I visited this place on my airbnb guided tour. It's a photo stop. Extremely busy street. You can climb up the building on the opposite side to take photos. There are two cafes - winds cafe and tattoo cafe from where you can take photos.

Name: Shashidhar G
Title: Should you visit Hawamahal, Jaipur?
Review: There is nothing much inside here to see, very uninteresting place, can be skipped, just seeing its front view while travelling on the road by slowly moving on a vehicle will be enough. Poorly maintained with uninteresting staff. You will become just like a baloon loosing its hawa after visiting the Hawamahal!

Name: ajay
Title: Hawa Mahal the identity of Jaipur
Review: Hawa Mahal or the wind palace is the quintessential landmark or identity of Jaipur constructed out of red sandstone it gives the city its name the pink city. Very well-maintained and clean palace.

Name: ARABAJ K
Title: Wind awesome
Review: Hawa mahal located middle of jaipur . All facility are available here . Most beautiful palace in jaipur city . Highly recommend this palace to visit here

Name: james
Title: Lovely wind palace
Review: Most of the wind palace located middle of jaipur. It is really good palace in Jaipur.  All area was clear and clean Here.

Name: Eileen G
Title: Quintessential "pink city" building
Review: It's the quintessential building of the "pink city". I got a great photo of it from across the street (crossing the street is VERY exciting)! It was a nice stop on our street tour of old city Jaipur.

Name: Rahul Mishra
Title: A beautiful diamonds in the crown of Jaipur
Review: Not only is it the most beautiful place in Jaipur, at the same time, if you do not go here, then your Jaipur trip will remain incomplete. Try going here twice, once during the day and once in the evening when the lighting is done.

Name: FREAKS GUILD O
Title: Hawamahal
Review: It was great win palace in Jaipur city so many windows here. It is very famous in jaipur.its great story win palace .on of my best experience here

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: A historic palace which needs more planning and maintenance by Govt.
Review: A wonderful historic palace which needs more maintenance. The security personnel deployed are not at all taking care. But a must visit place in Jaipur.

Name: Rishi usta
Title: LAL CHAND USTAD FROM UDAIPUR LAL CHAND USTAD (ARCHITECT) HAWA MAHAL
Review: Lal chand ustad indian architect of hawa mahal from udaipur. Lal chand ustad from udaipur district......

Name: Nakul6798
Title: Iconic
Review: Hawa mahal is a marvelous piece of architecture and ofcourse the icon of Jaipur.  It was lovely visiting it (although just from outside).  There are lots of visitors around and couple of cafes opposite it offer best views of it (no wonder social media is full of these shots).

Name: Shravan B
Title: Good place to take photos
Review: You get a nice view of the city from the top and is a good place to take photos from both inside as well as outside of the placeHas a good market place around to do some shopping and is very near to the City Place

Name: Mickel
Title: Hawa Mahal visit..
Review: Such a great view from hawa mahal I had amazing to time to see the Hawa Mahal and we enjoyed to click photo and so much fun..

Name: DaveNavigator
Title: Hawa mahal palace of winds
Review: It is a signature monument of Jaipur and should be a unesco world heritage list. A great place for photography and to see the perfect sign of Rajputana architecture. Must visit place also known as palace of winds.

Name: Prema_C
Title: Engineering marvel
Review: I visited hawa mahal from inside for the first time and was amazed with the genius mind of the builders. It was so airy from inside, gave a street view from one side and was well lit. Must visit in Jaipur.

Name: Ramkumar C
Title: Attractive place at jaipur
Review: We all loved the place The architecture of this is very funtastic that it was created very different.Without any fan and cooler the place is very cool due to the winds comes in it

Name: Tsturgess
Title: Beautiful building
Review: Best to go early in morning as gets crowded in front later on, it's just something to amaze at, you cannot go insideBeautiful building

Name: kim buay p
Title: Gorgeous pink city
Review: I did a guided live stream walking tour of the pink city of Jaipur with Dilip from Heygo.He was an excellent guide who taught us so much about Jaipur's history, architecture and way of life. After independence in 1947, Jaipur was made the capital of the newly formed state of Rajasthan. He explained why the buildings are all painted pink in the old town.  The city was painted pink to welcome HRH Albert Edward, Prince of Wales (who later became King Edward VII, Emperor of India), in 1876.  Many of the avenues still remain painted in pink, giving Jaipur a distinctive appearance and the epithet Pink city.   Even the buses are pink.  We also noticed that there are no policemen or traffic lights guiding the traffic on the roads but it works well among the citizens.  There was much honkings but it was not due to impatient drivers. It is just a way of life for the drivers to greet each other.  He showed us beautiful pink roadside buildings where the shops are on the ground floor while the businessmen and their families live upstairs.  He also mentioned that ladies in Jaipur like to dressed in bright colours to make up for lack of colour in the desert part of Jaipur.Even the street lamp posts are lovely.  When we reached the majestic and gorgeous Hawa Mahal, he explained that the facade with lattice windows were for the royal ladies to view the street processions without being seen.  There are many windows as in the past the Maharajas had many wives.  The pink colour for buildings is mandatory for the common people.  Dilip kindly allowed us to take very good postcard shots of Hawa Mahal.  However this rule did not apply to the Maharaja as we noticed the entrance to his Palace is not painted in pink.He also pointed out the flowers market near the temples as the flowers are used as offerings to the God,  Popular colours are red (which symbolises energy) and yellow (knowledge and wisdom).

Name: Vivek k aggarwal
Title: Amazing
Review: Very nice experience and too windy ! Loved this architectural excellence! Would like to visit more often to this place.

Name: Dulichand S
Title: Castle of winds.
Review: Very beautiful historic place to watch in Jaipur. It is actually very famous place in Jaipur to watch.Must visit place in Jaipur due to its architecture design.Very well designed art in Jaipur. Hawa mahal means the castle of winds.I recommend the place for must watch in Jaipur.

Name: lulu
Title: Rating hawa mahal feb 2018
Review: Activity is only viewing and taking photos, a tour guide is a must without knowing the reason of the building you wouldnt enjoy.. however we only spent 5mins to take photos and there was no car park nearby

Name: Sanjay mahavar
Title: Hawa Mahal
Review: It is a beautiful palace in jaipur. It is palace of wind. There are many small widows make for wind passing into the palace. The palace so beautiful that you can't forget it from my memory.

Name: Surya S
Title: It was a very beautiful place special for a family and couples.
Review: It reminds us a very established and well designed Architecture of indians. This is made by the kings of the Rajasthan for his queen. And the design is very unique.. the winds will come for every windows. Best place for the couple and family to see the historic symbol of india and Rajasthan.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is the face of Jaipur. The architecture is beautiful and it is located in the middle of a crowded road. You can simply click a few photos from just across the road if you don't have much time.

Name: The Traveller
Title: Looks like Crown
Review: The old architecture is always unique and antique. Same this Hawa Mahal in jaipur is one of the best example of old architecture.

Name: Pushpak Rai
Title: Amazing Pink color architect
Review: Hawa Mahal is famous for its architect. Mahal is build of red and pink stone which makes the interior look different from the rest of the forts of Rajasthan. Hawa Mahal is located in mid of the Jaipur. The surrounding area is the crowd. You just need a max of 1 hour to explore this fort.

Name: Neha Jadhav
Title: Must Visit Place In Jaipur!
Review: Jaipur's Most-Distinctive Landmark "The Hawa Mahal" Or "Palace Of Winds" ❤️◾Let me tell you few facts about "Hawa Mahal", 1. It has 953 jharokhas (windows).2. It is extraordinary pink-painted, delicately honeycombed hive that rises a dizzying five storeys.3. The most shocking and interesting fact about Hawa Mahal is that this five story palace has no foundation. And it's considered to be world's tallest building without any foundation.4. It has no direct entrance. It's built on an edge of the city palace because it was built as a part of it.

Name: gautamroy2000
Title: Visit to Hawamahal
Review: Hawa Mahal is a Worth visiting place. It's a landmark building of Jaipur. Required more protection against encroachment by local

Name: KALA Nikhil
Title: Must visit
Review: One should hire a guide from hawa mahal who will continue to jantar mantar and city palace.Must visit in jaipur

Name: mohnish bose
Title: Great photo-op
Review: This iconic structure is synonymous with the Pink City, and enjoys wonderful cross winds. It looks prettier on the outside than on the inside though. Those with cameras will certainly enjoy clicking it in the night as well. Gets a little too crowded at times though!

Name: Rahul G
Title: The sky tower
Review: The power of wind against this massive structure . It is rightly called the hawa mahal as it is very difficult to stand on the terrace against the powerful gust of winds. Amazing specimen of art and architecture.

Name: Old Pro
Title: Meh
Review: It's just a building along the side of the road and I don't see everybody's attraction to it. I guess it's kind of cool but I wouldn't go out of my way to get there

Name: Niteash
Title: Looks like a park
Review: Its quite crowded and not well navigated. Good place to see even if you just see it from outside. Nothing much from inside.

Name: Mohit Sharma
Title: Not good
Review: Only beautiful in the outside but inside nothing to seen this and good but not very good and very high peak

Name: JayeshLC
Title: Only a Photo Stop
Review: It is basically visited for taking pictures and can be only visited from outside. I did not personally visit this site.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Mesmerising Hawa Mahal !!!!
Review: This is called ancient air conditioner of the town. It was build to keep the City Palace (behind Hawa Mahal) cool. The water use to flow alongwith the windows so the the air passing the windows will generate cool air. We had a nice time clicking pictures in from of this Mahal.

Name: Dr Niraj Kumar
Title: Excellent
Review: Very good architecture, you feel like you have gone to that eraSituated in a crowded place. Can be more organized

Name: Geo Mathews
Title: Visit
Review: Do not.. I say it again.. Do not... Take a guide from the road side, who will claim to take u to all the important locations. We made that mistake. They have no knowledge. Hire an official guide from the premises of the monument.The Rajasthan emporium of the maharani is good, but pls keep at least 2 hrs fr it.The area in front of thebGuru Nanak Gurudwara has a large space where u can park ur car, free of cost. The Hawa Mahal is 800m from there.Hawa Mahal was OK. Can get some gud snaps there

Name: Pakhi B
Title: Good place
Review: Good place to go with family and friends, very beautiful at night, must visit if going to jaipur ...

Name: rahilpanja
Title: Beautiful and simply spell bounding
Review: Don’t take this attraction less serious. Climb up the top and experience pink city - Jaipur views. Looks fantastic from outside, especially in the evening time.

Name: kashy08
Title: Beautiful
Review: Yes this place is amazingly beautiful... you can't get enough of it... mesmerizing view from inside and outside. A place you must visit if you are in the city.

Name: Jason Roy
Title: An Incredible Building.
Review: This is very nice but busy area of Jaipur. But worth taking the time this is an architectural wonder. The ambience inside    is Royal. you feel like a king walking inside the whole palace is visible from the rooftop cafe opposite to it.reminds you of the rich history of the place .A must visit place for all the history freaks. Fantastic experience in Jaipur city...

Name: AmitGanatra
Title: Amazing
Review: The cleanliness was good and the ticket prices was even good. The staaf was also supportive. We would recommend this. The place is very good

Name: ANIL SEN VERMA
Title: Anil Sen Verma
Review: Landmark of Jaipur Rajasthan Pink City,,,,an old building, Architecturaly strong message of friendship with natrue and air,,,a must visit and experience the air flow as well as the Architecture

Name: Nandini
Title: Visual treat by night
Review: During the day, due to hustle bustle and over crowded streets , you might not enjoy jostling through the crowd., I ceretainly did not enjoy that. Also, in that area, all shops have their names in Hindi which I think is unfair as you cannot expect all to read the names only in that official language.  The same area once the shops close is a visual treat. It was lit up and it can blow away your sense. The only jarring point was the huge banner displayed with the covid instructions and the CM's face.  That for tourists, that was an eye sore.  The illumination though , takes away all the negative aspects

Name: Exploration276081
Title: Wonder of Indian  architecture
Review: Palace of winds , a palace built by Maharaja Praatap singh in the year 1799 a.d.. I came to know during my visit that the palace which normally think and see is in fact the backside of the building , the frontside  is entered through Tripolia bazar and than we reach to a courtyard known as Rajendra hazari guards  now office of Jaipur Nagar Nigam. The Palace could be entered through a gate and than through a rampart could reach to the top to see the overlooking view of hawa mahal baza. I was told by our guide that the palace has 945 latticed windows  from where the ladies of the royal court could see the processions without being seen by public. I was also told by our guide that the widows have been built only with the help of lime only and there is no use of stone or bricks. The architecture is like a peacock feather because the Maharaja was devoted to Lord Krishna and peacock feather is the crown of lord Krishna.

Name: travelnomadNZ
Title: Stunning Sight Hawa Mahal
Review: Hawa Mahal - Palace of the Wind was stunning. I saw it by day on an Intrepid Tour. I believe it would be amazing by night. The road and traffic was very busy so we didn’t stop long.Hint: make sure you have a guide familiar with Hawa Mahal so they can explain the history. Suitable footwear and clothing. A good camera (video option) and sunglasses.

Name: Naresh Kumar
Title: Looks awesome by night
Review: One should make an additional trip by night to see it dazzle from outside, with the brilliant lighting.

Name: Arnab_phenomenon
Title: Beautiful from outside.
Review: Hawa Mahal or The Palace of Winds was completed in 1799 and is made up of red and pink sandstone. This popular tourist spot that you see in my pictures is actually the back of the palace. I didn't go inside, didn't need to, coz the view from outside is good enough :-) lovely place for a photo op. The shops on the other side of the Palace are worth visiting for clothes/accessories shopping

Name: DOUG and NIKI
Title: Secret Instagram Location!
Review: What an amazing place for the best Instagram pics!  We have some secret locations but you are going to have to reach out to us or check out our videos for that info.

Name: Roney B
Title: The wind palace
Review: Hawa mahal is a landmark of the pink city Jaipur. It is situated in the heart of the city attracts people from the main road....

Name: CCC
Title: Beautiful Sight
Review: Beautiful architecture in Jaipur. Perfect for taking photos. Drive by sight. Takes a few minutes to view.

Name: Satish Charanpahari
Title: Historical architecture
Review: Wonderful historical architecture monument, these are the assets of Rajasthan. Jaipur is famous for HAWA MAHAL.

Name: Coastal826245
Title: Hawa@mahal
Review: i think one should visit jaipur in rainy season when wecwere on top of hawa mahal. the view of jaipur was outstanding. When the winds blows in these jharakos. it feels lovely

Name: Virus King
Title: Pride of of the Pink City - Jaipur
Review: One of the most famous tourist destinations in Jaipur, Hawa Mahal, also known as the palace of wind, is one of the most prominent attractions in Jaipur

Name: lokendra singh shekhavat
Title: Mesmerising view
Review: Oh god what a view such an epic piece of art. Reminds us how talented were those artists who built it.

Name: Vinay K
Title: Heart of jaipur
Review: Located at rhe centre of jaipur a palace where u can find history and art of manufacturing builduings , hows at that time king has done this work

Name: RosemarieNorth
Title: Exquisite
Review: Although you get a sense of the palace from the road, it’s only by exploring behind the facade that you get a sense of this truly wonderful building. Make sure your phone is charged - this is one of the most photogenic palaces I’ve ever visited.
